results.title: The Nature of science: how ideas change
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Dick Larson
results.brief_description: Scientific ideas are shown to be in a continual stage of modification and change. We investigate how and why scientific ideas change and in so doing clarify the criteria used to evaluate them, such as their accuracy, simplicity, productivity and scope. For primary grades.
results.title_for_label: The Nature of science: how ideas change
results.description: Scientific ideas are shown to be in a continual stage of modification and change. We investigate how and why scientific ideas change and in so doing clarify the criteria used to evaluate them, such as their accuracy, simplicity, productivity and scope. For primary grades.

results.title: The Nature of salt
results.brief_description: A short documentary showing how salt affects different environments, for example, how it kills grass. Also shows some laboratory-like experiments such as “water taking salt from soil”. Towards the end of the film we also see aspects of ‘salt mining’ via live footage and diagrams.
results.description: A short documentary showing how salt affects different environments, for example, how it kills grass. Also shows some laboratory-like experiments such as “water taking salt from soil”. Towards the end of the film we also see aspects of ‘salt mining’ via live footage and diagrams.

results.title: The Nature of prejudice: ' I wear my people's clothes'
results.creator_credit: Linda Schuyler, Playing With Time, Canadian Council of Christians and Jews and Kit Hood
results.brief_description: Attempts to break down people’s prejudices to people of other cultures by putting forward the view that prejudice is the result of fear based on lack of understanding. Interviews several people of ethnic origins living in Canada who still follow the customs and beliefs of their own cultures, including the wearing of particular clothing and hairstyles. Narrated by Professor Jamshed Mavalwala. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: The Nature of prejudice: ‘ I wear my people’s clothes’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Schuyler, Playing With Time, Canadian Council of Christians and Jews and Kit Hood

results.title: The Nature of Light
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Two teenage boys (Bud and Sandy) on a camping trip, demonstrate the uses of light through various practical experiments. Demonstrations include: the law of reflection, differences between convex and concave lenses, how the eye works etc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films

results.title: The Nature of life: the living cell
results.brief_description: Photomicrography investigates single-celled and multi-celled organisms - how they produce or absorb food, convert food to energy, respond to their environments, and reproduce. Simple experiments seen through a standard microscope demonstrate the functions of cell structures; an electron microscope reveals smaller cell structures.
results.title_for_label: The Nature of life: the living cell
results.description: Photomicrography investigates single-celled and multi-celled organisms - how they produce or absorb food, convert food to energy, respond to their environments, and reproduce. results.title: The Nature of life: respiration in animals
results.brief_description: Explores the similarities of air-breathing and water-breathing animals, developing this concept through the animal kingdom to man himself. Demonstrations show the vital relationships between the animal’s size and the complexity of its respiratory system - between respiration, blood circulation and feeding.

results.description: Explores the similarities of air-breathing and water-breathing animals, developing this concept through the animal kingdom to man himself. results.title: The Nature of heat
results.brief_description: Explains heat as the energy of molecular motion. Experiments are used to demonstrate that heat is transferred by conduction, convection and radiation. Shows the effectiveness of various types of material in the transfer of heat.
results.description: Explains heat as the energy of molecular motion. Experiments are used to demonstrate that heat is transferred by conduction, convection and radiation. Shows the effectiveness of various types of material in the transfer of heat.

results.title: The Nature of healing
results.creator_credit: Brian Beaton, Celia Tait, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description: This 6 part series draws upon the combined knowledge of Eastern and Western medicine, and reveals techniques and therapies to achieve true health and harmony. It will change the way life and health is perceived.
